bill_title: revise certain worker's compensation provisions regarding employees with permanent total disabilities.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain worker's compensation provisions regarding employees with permanent total disabilities. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 62-4 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: If an employee is entitled to a permanent total disability pursuant to § 62-4-53 because the employee is unable to secure anything more than sporadic employment resulting in an insubstantial income as defined in subdivision 62-4-52(2) but the employer proves by a preponderance of the evidence that the employee is capable of returning to other employment earning a wage less than the employee's workers' compensation rate established by § 62-4-7, or the employee is employed but earning a wage less than the employee's workers' compensation rate established by § 62-4-7, the employer responsible for payment of workers' compensation benefits to the employee may, at its option, pay the difference between the amount the employee is capable of earning or is actually earning and the compensation rate established by § 62-4-7. However, in no event may the total net income to the employee be less than the amount the employee is entitled to receive pursuant to § 62-4-7, unless the employee refuses an offer of suitable employment.
